Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: பொய்மையும் வாய்மை யிடத்த புரைதீர்ந்தநன்மை பயக்கும் எனின்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Even falsehood has the nature of truth, if it confer a benefit that is free from fault.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A person is telling a falsehood, but with a pure intention. The spoken words are initially visualized as grey, misshapen forms, representing their literal untruth ('பொய்ம்மை').
Layered_Composition.Midground: These grey words travel towards a situation of great peril—perhaps an innocent person being hunted by a cruel tyrant. The words form a screen of illusion that misdirects the tyrant and saves the innocent person.
Layered_Composition.Background: Because the result of this falsehood is a 'faultless good' ('புரை தீர்ந்த நன்மை'), the grey, misshapen words, having achieved their noble purpose, transform into brilliant, pure, white forms, taking on the quality and place of Truth ('வாய்மை யிடத்த').

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: A falsehood can be considered as truth if its ultimate outcome is a completely faultless and beneficial good.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The transformation of the words from grey falsehood to white truth is the central, magical event. The 'faultless' nature of the good is shown by the clear innocence of the saved person and the clear evil of the thwarted tyrant.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Pragmatic virtue, consequentialist, noble lie, transformative.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The scene begins with the neutral grey of the lie. The act of salvation is dramatic. The final transformation of the words into pure white light is the climactic moment, changing the entire lighting of the scene to one of virtuous purity.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A narrative shot that follows the trajectory of the lie from the speaker's mouth, showing its impact and its ultimate transformation into truth.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, with advanced particle and transformation effects for the words.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: A dramatic shift in lighting as the falsehood is sanctified by its outcome.

Cultural_Anchors: Falsehood in the place of Truth (பொய்மையும் வாய்மை யிடத்த)
